remarks: The scalar product of a complex module matches the scalar product of the derived ` ZZ ` -module, which implies, together with ~ zlmbas and ~ zlmplusg , that any module over ` ZZ ` is structure-equivalent to the canonical ` ZZ ` -module ` ZMod `` G ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-Oct-2015.)
statement:
zlmclm.w $e |- W = ( ZMod ` G ) $.
clmzlmvsca.x $e |- X = ( Base ` G ) $.
clmzlmvsca $p |- ( ( G e. CMod /\ ( A e. ZZ /\ B e. X ) ) -> ( A ( .s ` G ) B ) = ( A ( .s ` W ) B ) ) $.
